    • Method Detail

      • intersectLineSegmentWithLineSegment

        public static final Vector2d intersectLineSegmentWithLineSegment(Vector2d ls1Start,
                                           Vector2d ls1End,
                                           Vector2d ls2Start,
                                           Vector2d ls2End)
        Calculate point of intersection between two line segments. This is precise, but a bit slow. Originally implemented by Marius Watz
        Parameters:
        ls1Start - First line segment, start point
        ls1End - First line segment, end point
        ls2Start - Second line segment, start point
        ls2End - Second line segment, end point
        Returns:
        A vector to the point of intersection, or null if lines are parallel, collinear, or segments not overlapping.

      • intersectLineSegmentStartingFromCircleMidPointWithCircle

        public static final Vector2d intersectLineSegmentStartingFromCircleMidPointWithCircle(Vector2d start,
                                                                Vector2d end,
                                                                double radius)
        Calculate intersection of a circle and a line segment. The line segment has to start at the circle's midpopint.
        Parameters:
        start - Start point of line segment, same as circle midpoint
        end - End point of line segment
        radius - radius of circle
        Returns:
        Either a vector (point of intersection), or null (no intersection at all - the end point is within the radius of the circle).

      • intersectLineSegmentWithCircle

        public static final Vector2d[] intersectLineSegmentWithCircle(Vector2d start,
                                        Vector2d end,
                                        Vector2d midPoint,
                                        double radius)
        Calculate intersection of a circle and a line segment.
        Parameters:
        start - Start point of line segment
        end - End point of line segment
        midPoint - center of circle
        radius - radius of circle
        Returns:
        Either two vectors (line segment is intersecting circle in two places), one vector (line segment intersects in one place), no vectors (line segment does not intersect circle, but line through points does), or null (no intersection at all).

      • pointExistsWithinEpsilon

        public static final boolean pointExistsWithinEpsilon(java.util.List<Vector2d> points,
                               Vector2d point)
        Checks if a point is very close to any of other points in a given list. Useful for dealing with numerical imprecision.
        Parameters:
        points - The points to check against each
        point - The point that will be checked
        Returns:

      • isPointInCircle

        public static boolean isPointInCircle(Vector2d point,
                      Vector2d circleCenter,
                      double circleRadius)
